item.dc:creator: @Sup22211 Sup22211
item.description:
@Sup22211 wrote:

[quote=“God_Pure, post:6, topic:520025”]I am not going to write the code for you, but this is how you could make it. If ItemId is equiped & cmonkey=3 equip, else send message You need to complete monkey madness
The =3 can also be made to if its below 3 then it wont lets you equip it, but I guess I just like it to be exact and complicated more complicated than it has to be. :P[/quote]
Exactly what i said but you have more lines of code + a chance to fail

I am not going to write the code for you, but this is how you could make it. If ItemId is equiped & cmonkey=3 equip, else send message You need to complete monkey madness
The =3 can also be made to if its below 3 then it wont lets you equip it, but I guess I just like it to be exact and complicated more complicated than it has to be.

item.title: [PI] [Hard I guess?] Weapon Requires Quest Completed [PI]
item.dc:creator: @The7thSanctum The7thSanctum
item.description:
@The7thSanctum wrote:

Just make a playersave for the quest, when they complete it, change it to a number.

If you’re using a case, put an if statement to check if the number is higher than the number you wish and make sure you add another or else if to send a message if it’s lower. If you’re using it like you showed us, just add an extra if to check there. It’s quite easy.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Sup22211 Sup22211
item.description:
@Sup22211 wrote:

Like int bauk said make a new boolean/int and then when you click check if the boolean is equals to true/to 3(3 because you said then its complete)
i am not sure how to do this in PI but think of the dragon scimi like this;
if(itemID == dScim && c.monkey < 3){
send him message that he need to complete the quest…
}

item.title: [PI] [Hard I guess?] Weapon Requires Quest Completed [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Driman_Rune Driman Rune
item.description:
@Driman_Rune wrote:

Hi their! Yet again another problem.

File: I think it is in itemassistant.java

Problem: I want to make it so that Dragon Scimitar requires Monkey Madness completed, which i will add. But in my [playerassistant.java player.java] I added: c.monkeym = 0;, i know how to add quests but when it is c.monkeym = 3;, it means your done with the quest i add if(itemName.contains(“dragon”)) {
if (!itemName.contains(“nti-”) && !itemName.contains(“fire”)) {
c.attackLevelReq = c.defenceLevelReq = 60;
c.monkeym = 3;
return;
}
}

And it doesn’t work, i also added the imports to player and playerasistant and playersave.

So if someone knows how to do this easier way can anyone help me!?

Thanks

Read full topic
